system.description:
As a Celebrity, you have crowds of people pining for your attention. In some cases, individuals from your flock will leap forward into the throws of conflict to take your place.

When you take a level in Call Entourage, you gain an Entourage Member. At the start of your turn during a Conflict in a settlement or other similar populated location, you can spend a Reputation Point to choose to substitute yourself with one of your Entourage Members. When you do this, the chosen Entourage Member takes your place in the combat. You remain separate creature, but all things that would target you, target your Entourage Member.

At the start of each of your turns, you can choose to either act, or have your active Entourage Member act. If you act while an Entourage Member is out, you cannot target enemies with Attacks or Spells, and cannot take the Guard action.

When an Entourage Member is reduced to 0 Hit Points, you take their place once the damage has resolved. If your Entourage Member is Targeted with an Attack or Spell but is reduced to 0 Hit Points before the effect resolves, you become the new Target.

The following Entourage Members are available when you gain a new one.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.j9SR0pA2kmoT2BlE]{Aristocrat}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.TIMkq8fwjl04se0F]{Brute}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.M4PFIjVEUHVsBz2i]{Enforcer}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.clmtR0rXkuqLxQQJ]{Entertainer}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.q4A7nr9AlLbYHXzF]{Laborer}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.lLzh8iKFQkFxECx3]{Merchant}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-npcs.Actor.B0fepO49Qm3bsNlc]{Vagrant}

The Entourage Members you have represent the kinds of people your status appeals to, and the

types of people that might come to your defense. For example:

❖ Having Entertainers in your Entourage may mean your fame appeals to the talented.

❖ Having Priests in your Entourage may mean your fame appeals to those of faith.

❖ and having Thieves in your Entourage may mean your fame appeals to the dastardly.
